question_string: Convert $1#random_between(-32, 20)# into $2#random_between(6, 8)#-bit two's complement binary representation.
Provide decimal representation of $1#random_negative_binary_len(8)# in two's complement.
Calculate $1#random_hex_len(4)# - $2#random_hex_len(4)# when these values represent unsigned 16-bit hexadecimal numbers. Give your answer in hexadecimal assuming unsaturated arithmetic.
Assume $1#random_between(180, 200)# and $2#random_between(120, 137)# are signed 8-bit decimal integers stored in sign-magnitude format. Calculate $1 + $2 in decimal.
Assume $1#random_between(180, 200)# and $2#random_between(120, 137)# are signed 8-bit decimal integers stored in sign-magnitude format. Calculate $1 - $2 in decimal.
Assume $1#random_between(180, 200)# and $2#random_between(120, 137)# are signed 8-bit decimal integers stored in two's complement format. Calculate $1 - $2 in decimal.
Present the hexadecimal representation of the following assembly instruction: add x$1#random_between(20, 30)#, x$2#random_between(20, 30)#, x$3#random_between(20, 30)#. Answer in hexadecimal.
Present the hexadecimal representation of the following assembly instruction: lb x$1#random_between(20, 30)#, $3#random_between(0, 100)#(x$2#random_between(20, 30)#). Answer in hexadecimal.
Present the hexadecimal representation of the following assembly instruction: sb x$1#random_between(20, 30)#, $3#random_between(0, 100)#(x$2#random_between(20, 30)#). Answer in hexadecimal.
Present the hexadecimal representation of the following assembly instruction: beq x$1#random_between(20, 30)#, x$2#random_between(20, 30)#, $3#random_between(0, 100, 4)#. Answer in hexadecimal.
